comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: James Keteltas Hackett (1869-1926) was a Canadian-born American stage actor. The first Mrs. J. K. Hackett was Engilsh stage actress Mary Mannering (1876-1953); the couple married in 1897. They had one child, Elise. In 1908, Mary began divorce proceedings, but then called them off; in 1909, James had financial problems enough to make the papers. In time, James Hackett married English actress Beatrice Mary Beckley (b. 1885, married Hackett in 1911), and Mary Mannering married another man, Frederick E. Wadsworth. If this image was made in 1914, that should be the second Mrs. Hackett, Beatrice Mary Beckley. Beatrice and James starred together in a 1913 film of The Prisoner of Zenda. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Keteltas_Hackett www.imdb.com/name/nm0065773/ en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mary_Mannering

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: pennylrichardsca: thanks for the research on James Keteltas Hackett and his wife Beatrice Mary Beckley. Photos of him in younger days can be found at the New York Public Library, such as this one: digitalgallery.nypl.org/nypldigital/id?TH-17856 A portrait by Arnold Genthe of Beatrice is in the Prints and Photographs Online Catalog: www.loc.gov/pictures/item/agc1996007424/PP/ We will expand the description when we update the database.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of June 26, 1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0714FD3F5E13738... has Hackett returning from Europe on the Imperator, having left on March 31. NYT of April 1, 1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B05EFD71730E733A... confirms that Hackett sailed on the Lusitania on March 31, 1914.
